weather_report:
As twilight descends upon Downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere feels alive yet tranquil. Tonight, the skies are partly cloudy, presenting a canvas where the fading light mingles delicately with shadows, wrapping the city in a serene embrace. A gentle north-northeast breeze whispers through the streets, stirring the air just enough to remind you of the approaching winter chill. With temperatures dipping to around 47 degrees, this is a night that invites those with an appreciation for the subtle textures of the evening to don a light jacket or a cozy sweater, perhaps even a scarf to ward off the coolness as the hours stretch into the night.

Looking ahead to Thursday, the sun promises a return, gracing the city with a cheery disposition. It will rise bright and bold, bringing warmth to the chill of December mornings, with a high near 59 degrees. As the day unfolds, a slight dip in temperature may beckon one to seek shelter from the brisk air, but the clarity of the sky will offer a perfect backdrop for leisurely explorations. This would be a splendid time for leisurely strolls along the waterfront or through the maze of vibrant neighborhoods, where the city comes alive with sights and sounds. Embrace the day with layers—perhaps a light jacket that can be shed in favor of sunshine and warmth, allowing you to fully appreciate this golden hour of winter in the Bay Area.
